Build and Deploy a Pumilio Bioacoustics Server

  • 2 Test build pumilio on Nectar Research Cloud

1 Introduction to pumilio server

We will build a pumilio server to test.

2 Test build pumilio on Nectar Research Cloud

2.1 System Description

We will launch our server on Ubuntu 12.04 LTS because the LTS version will probably be the most stable Ubuntu release.

2.2 Set up the Firewall

ssh -i foobarkey ubuntu@ip.address.of.server
sudo passwd ubuntu
exit
# enter again to test
sudo su
ufw status verbose
ufw enable
# yes 
ufw allow from my.ip.range.74.0/24 to any app OpenSSH
ufw allow from my.ip.add.ress to any port 80
exit

2.3 The LAMP webservice stack

I got the instructions for this from https://help.ubuntu.com/community/ApacheMySQLPHP 

#First install tasksel...
sudo apt-get install tasksel
#... and then the LAMP stack:
sudo tasksel install lamp-server

# NB I got the following errors

2.4 Pumilio dependencies

Follow the instructions on the pumilio site http://pumilio.sourceforge.net/help.html 

sudo apt-get install python-dev python-setuptools python-numpy libsndfile1-dev libasound2-dev imagemagick sox libsox-fmt-* python-imaging python-mysqldb flac lame
#Then download audiolab version 0.8 and extract:
wget http://pypi.python.org/packages/source/s/scikits.audiolab/scikits.audiolab-0.8.tar.gz
tar -xzf scikits.audiolab-0.8.tar.gz
cd scikits.audiolab-0.8
sudo python setup.py install

2.5 Download the pumilio source code

  sudo su
  cd /var/www
  wget http://sourceforge.net/projects/pumilio/files/pumilio-2.6.0.tar.gz
  tar -xzf pumilio-2.6.0.tar.gz 

  #Create a database and user in MySQL, you can use the mysql utility or phpmyadmin. Then, on your browser, go to the application URL, adding install/. For example, if the address is #http://somehost.com/pumilio, then go to http://somehost.com/pumilio/install/
  #This will check the necessary software and folder permissions. Add an administrative user. After this step you can delete the folders install and upgrade.

  mysql -u root -p
  #Create a mysql database

  CREATE DATABASE database1;

  #Create a mysql user

  #For creating a new user with all privileges (use only for troubleshooting), at mysql prompt type:

  GRANT ALL PRIVILEGES ON *.* TO 'yourusername'@'localhost' IDENTIFIED BY 'yourpassword' WITH GRANT OPTION;

  #For creating a new user with fewer privileges (should work for most web applications) which can only use the database named "database1", at mysql prompt type:

  # NOT RUN
  #GRANT SELECT, INSERT, UPDATE, DELETE, CREATE, DROP, INDEX, ALTER, CREATE TEMPORARY TABLES, LOCK TABLES ON database1.* TO 'yourusername'@'localhost' IDENTIFIED BY 'yourpassword';

  #yourusername and yourpassword can be anything you like. database1 is the name of the database the user gets access to. localhost is the location which gets access to your database. #You can change it to '%' (or to hostnames or ip addresses) to allow connections from every location (or only from specific locations) to the database. Note, that this can be a #security problem and should only be used for testing purposes!

  \q

  service apache2 restart

  # in browser
  http://xxxxx/pumilio-2.6.0/install/

  # The configuration file (config.php) could not be found. Please rename the file config.php.dist to config.php and fill the appropiate values.
  cd /var/www/pumilio-2.6.0
  cp config.php.dist /home/config.php.backup
  mv config.php.dist config.php


  nano config.php

  #db stuff
  # R = TRUE

sudo gedit /etc/apt/sources.list
# add the line
deb http://cran.csiro.au/bin/linux/ubuntu quantal/
sudo apt-get update
sudo apt-get install r-base r-base-dev  
R
## During startup - Warning messages:
## 1: Setting LC_TIME failed, using "C" 
## 2: Setting LC_PAPER failed, using "C" 
## 3: Setting LC_PAPER failed, using "C" 
## 4: Setting LC_MEASUREMENT failed, using "C" 

  http://xxx/pumilio-2.6.0/install/
  # add admin user, marco 
  rm -R install
  rm -R upgrade
  # log in as admin  got messages
  #The R package 'tuneR' was not found.  Log out log in to refresh list of unmet R depends
  #The server can not write to the temporary folder, tmp/, some features will not work. Please set the webserver as the owner of the directory or change the permissions to read and write.
  #The server can not write to the archive folder, sounds/, some features will not work. Please set the webserver as the owner of the directory or change the permissions to read and write.
  #The server can not write to the site photographs folder, sitephotos/, some features will not work. Please set the webserver as the owner of the directory or change the permissions to read and write.
  sudo su
  # check user exists
  id -a www-data
  chown -R www-data /var/www
  apt-get install fftw3 fftw3-dev pkg-config
  sudo apt-get install libcurl4-openssl-dev
  sudo apt-get install r-cran-xml    
  # set write to  sitephotos/,
  su - www-data
  cd /var/www/pumilio-2.6.0
  mkdir sitephotos



  su - www-data
  R
  install.packages("tuneR")
  install.packages("seewave", dependencies = T)
  install.packages("RCurl", dependencies = T)
  install.packages("XML", dependencies = T)
  # create lib
  ## q()
  ## exit

  ## su - www-data
  ## R
  #install.packages("seewave", dependencies = T)
  install.packages("RMySQL", dependencies = T)
## INSTRUCTIONS:

## 1. Define and export the 2 shell variables PKG_CPPFLAGS and
##    PKG_LIBS to include the directory for header files (*.h)
##    and libraries, for example (using Bourne shell syntax):

##       export PKG_CPPFLAGS="-I<MySQL-include-dir>"
##       export PKG_LIBS="-L<MySQL-lib-dir> -lmysqlclient"

##    Re-run the R INSTALL command:

##       R CMD INSTALL RMySQL_<version>.tar.gz

## 2. Alternatively, you may pass the configure arguments
##       --with-mysql-dir=<base-dir> (distribution directory)
##    or
##       --with-mysql-inc=<base-inc> (where MySQL header files reside)
##       --with-mysql-lib=<base-lib> (where MySQL libraries reside)
##    in the call to R INSTALL --configure-args='...' 

##    R CMD INSTALL --configure-args='--with-mysql-dir=DIR' RMySQL_<version>.tar.gz

## ERROR: configuration failed for package ‘RMySQL’
## * removing ‘/var/www/R/x86_64-pc-linux-gnu-library/3.0/RMySQL’

## The downloaded source packages are in
##      ‘/tmp/RtmpELDKzu/downloaded_packages’

  # bah now is ineq... try their cran pack
  install.packages("pumilioR", dependencies = T)
  # nope
  install.packages("ineq", dependencies = T)

  # make a general user
  log in as admin user, 'admin' top right, Users
